data: Boston was shrouded in a mantle of mist that November day, the north-east wind bringing at each blast re-enforcement to the all-enveloping and obscuring mass of gloom that embraced the city in its arms of darkness.
Blood Will Tell: The Strange Story of a Son of Ham
Davenport, Benjamin Rush; Donahey, J. H. (James Harrison), 1875-1949 [Illustrator]
